Reviews.Title: Don't believe the "Techies" that claim to know
Reviews.Author: Dale Chaney
Reviews.Content: EasyN "F" series cameras are very inexpensive at around $50 each, and are also very functional little devices.  But, they do require a little finesse and tolerance when trying to understand broken English mixed with Mandarin (Chinese).  Simply stated, it is difficult to understand the installation directions and software that comes prepackaged with it.  And, more often than not, installers quickly become disenfranchised when it doesn't work "out-of-the-box".  With that in mind, here is a simple tutorial/reference.First, the hardware is actually quite outstanding.  It is functionally a full blown Linux based computer with a camera attached.  With that in mind, consider that when adding 3 cameras to your network, you are actually adding 3 computers, each with a camera and a network connection.  So, complexity quickly increases.This camera includes 2-way panning, 2-way audio, infrared lighting, wired and/or wireless connectivity, image inversion, remote access via smartphone, and remote control via smartphone or web browser, audio and visual detection with optional alarms, MPEG4 compression, and multiple frame rates.  Such stats are unheard of in a consumer grade wireless camera.  To get this kind of functionality in another camera, would cost upwards of twice to five times the money.But, be aware that because this is a "wireless" camera, it can place a high demand on your network infrastructure and router.  So, if you are not using a Wireless-N router, or do not have it configured correctly, this camera can deplete your available bandwidth, rendering "all" wireless devices, including this camera, buggy/choppy requiring frequent reconnects.  Also, if you are "sharing" a wireless channel with your neighbor, you'll quickly become very disenchanted - this is what causes most "techie" people to complain loudly.  If you have a smartphone, install the "WiFi Analyzer" which will show you any channel conflicts.So, before you attempt to use this camera, make sure that you have sufficient "N" bandwidth, and that it is not being used by other "streamers".  I highly suggest a 300mbs "N" connection using a 300mbs router with a 300mbs NIC (if you don't understand this, do some research first).  And, be aware that multiple cameras compound the need for bandwidth.Alternatively, you might want to consider a "wired" connection, as the EasyN includes a connection for it.  Simply connect an RJ45 cable from the camera directly to your router.  If you are short of connections, which is common, you might need to add an additional "switch" to your configuration, which is a good option as expansion is nearly always required eventually.--------------------------------------------------------------------The software, is very "Chinese/foreign", in that it does not use proper English in its documentation - very common these days.  But that does not diminish what the software can actually do, with a little patience.Here's a list of features that it offers: Up to 81 cameras supported by the software (most of them wired) Unique by-camera configurations (cam-1 ceiling, cam-2 desktop) Image inversion (allows hanging camera upside down on ceiling)  PTZ support (remote Pan, Tilt, Zoom controls) Audio intrusion detection and recording IP based or Serial# based cameras Automatic recording, and automatic triggering  on either Action or ScheduleFinally, the software is a bit buggy.  But, considering the cost of commercial quality software, it's a bargain.  So, the simplest way to describe the package is that it is "Very functional, but requires a lot of hands-on tinkering to get it to work adequately".  After you've mastered the software, you'll ask yourself, "what was so hard initially?".If you'd prefer the much better commercial software, give "Blue Iris" a try, as that's the best available right now.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The camera must be configured as a wired device first, as that is how one specifies it's wireless properties. To do that, you must connect an RJ45 "WIRE" from your router to the camera at your desk.  Once that is done, you should use their "EasyN IP Camera Finder" in Wizard mode to locate it on your network.  Once located, you can use that same utility to specify your wireless options, such as camera name, IP, port, DNS and the like.  I suggest that if you are not an expert, you simply use their defaults initially.  Be prepared to write down the IP address and port number for future use.  In time, you will find out that you'll need to specify a static IP,instead of a DHCP generated one, as it is best to have a constant IP (note that the Camera Finder displays "your PC" info on the left, and the "camera" info on the right).  If you're not familiar with defining a static IP, do some research on YouTube to get educated, as that is beyond the scope of this article.Once you have defined an appropriate IP address and related port number, you are ready to go.  Simply use the Camera Finder, and make sure that it has updated the camera with the definition.  Then place the camera where you'd like it long term (i.e. on a shelf, in the living room, etc.).  Be aware, that like all Night Vision cameras if you have it behind a window you will get glare at night, so use some electrical tape to cover the LED's.  You'll rarely need to play with the camera again, once placed.Use your browser to access the camera from anywhere in the world.  Simply type the URL: 192.168.1.xxx:81 (the xxx is the IP on your sub-net, and the "81" is the port that you've defined).  This should prompt you for a user-id and optional password.  Simply use "admin" without a password if you used the defaults.  It will then request what type of browser that you are using - do a little reading, and come up with an appropriate answer.  Remember to click "do not show next time".You should be presented with a display of what your camera "see's".  Play with the controls until you understand what they do.  You can't break anything.  Be aware, that the line that begins with "Preset:" allows you to predefine up to nine locations that the camera can recall for positioning (the camera defaults to position one when first turned on).  Be aware too, that you might need to adjust the camera so that "position 1" is where it should be, when you first power the camera - play with it.This same browser access can be had via a smartphone (Android or Ipod), to view your camera(s).  But, a better choice might be to use "IP Cam Viewer Free" as it has support for multiple cameras.---------------------------------------------------------------------Ok, now start the EasyN Super Client, which is the PC based end of the connection. It is the part that allows you to manage the camera, trigger actions, view videos and signal activity.  It is quite simple, yet fully functional.  Don't get overwhelmed, though, as it can be intimidating at first.The client shows the "current" camera view on the left, and controls on the right. You can select which camera's view is displayed, as it also lists all cameras that have been defined.In the lower right portion of the camera display (view) are a few icons that provide immediate access.  These are "audio", "record", "snapshot", and "options".  They are meant for quick access to specific functions.  Be aware that the "audio off" option does not appear to work correctly.Below the list of cameras, is a depiction of various display choices.  Pick one that you like, by clicking on the icon.  There is also an option to display cameras in sequence, should you like to do that.The circular PTZ control allows you to manage the view of the camera(s).  Use this to position the view for specific items of interest.  Note that the center button is actually a "reset" function to reposition the camera to the default view seen at power-on.  Use the browser option to predefine the default view and set it as #1.To the right of the PTZ control, are various options that allow you to move the camera lens, such as pan-left/right, pan-up/down, position by preset, and activate audio (be careful, as feedback is an real possibility).  Play with them, and get familiar with what you can do with them.Finally, six buttons allow you to control all cameras, set global options (as opposed to by camera), view captured videos, list trigger dates/times, and set other options.  Again play with them to gain familiarity.-----------------------------------------------------------------------Lastly, the "Super Client" is meant to be resident.  It can be specified to start automatically with Windows, remain in the system tray, and run in the background.  If you attempt to close it, it will prompt you to see if you're awake.  Answer appropriately.You can double-click on it when in the tray, and modify everything on the fly.  No need for restarts.Overall, pretty neat, eh?

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Jon Cunningham
Reviews.Content: Pros: this camera is very easy to use, has over 10 Pre-set positions that are changeable, good quality, camera.  I am running it wireless only and I have had no issues, its been running for over 3 months straight, I have had a couple power outages and I had to change a few settings so it would move to a preset after reinitialization.  I can watch the camera from my android phone, Iphone, Nokia, ect.cons: Initial setup is a little rough but if you follow the directions on the CD it goes very smoothly.  Like all NV (Night Vision) cameras if you have it behind a window you will get glare at night, but use some electrical tape and you will have no issue,Overall:  worth the cost for home or for small business keeping an eye on pets, kids, driveways, or even front doors.  I would love to have a better camera with thermal vision, but this works out perfectly.I hope that you have as much fun with this camera as I have, and if you are looking for DVR software try looking up Blue Iris.

Reviews.Title: Is OK
Reviews.Author: Luther
Reviews.Content: Power supply quit soon after installation. Like within a week of install. Setup is not that easy but can be done.

Reviews.Title: Great easy wireless camera!
Reviews.Author: Mark Biddle
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up and assign the wireless settings and remote alerting all self contained within the internal web interface.  I set it up to email me pictures any time someone walks by the camera.  Very easy!  The color/video quality is not great, but can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: Other than one "gotcha" it's great!
Reviews.Author: Philip John Daigle
Reviews.Content: If your wireless password has non alpha-num characters in it, the camera won't connect to it. Other than that, It's a good product at a great price!

Reviews.Title: wish it had longer range
Reviews.Author: sam sun
Reviews.Content: works great when close to the wi fi, as soon as its 15 feet away it fails to see the wifi. upset because its not that great in range.

Reviews.Title: Great for $50
Reviews.Author: David Allen
Reviews.Content: Yes,  u will feel like you are learning  Chinese while reading English,  but installation went well for me. Emailed the address to myself once the cam is set up on my home wired desktop. Am able to watch or check on grandma from multiple devices simultaneously: razr maxx,  samsung note10,  wired desktop,  home wireless latop all at once. Of course,  cell phone is choppy if not on wifi.

Reviews.Title: Set up a challenge but everything else is great
Reviews.Author: jesse tissot
Reviews.Content: Works great once we got it set up.  the directions say to enter password as the password but we actually had to leave it blank.

Reviews.Title: Works Great and was easy to configure
Reviews.Author: John Pagano "Tampa Engineer"
Reviews.Content: Used it to keep an eye on my pregnant mare.  Worked great at night with the Infra Red camera. Definitely worth it

Reviews.Title: i would recommend buying one
Reviews.Author: Russ O.
Reviews.Content: this camera is very good at what it does. i went and bought two of them. the set up isnt too much of a pain in the ass.IF YOU PLAN TO RECORD, you will have to install a screen recorder. ip cam recorders do not work for the type of stream this puts outi have not figured out how to use the camera outside of my home network. this product is for those who are technically inclined. i once called microsoft support to figure out a problem and ended up telling them how i fixed the problem myself.this is not for the technically challengedif for some reason you do not recieve the setup disc, dont even bother plugging this in. YOU MUST HAVE THE SETUP CDthe power cord is very short. i dont know the size plug it takes. i wanna estimate its a 3.5mm because it has a speaker jack in the back that the power cord fits into. lol made that mistake thinkin it was plugged in. oops.....by the way, it has a speaker jack.i would do a little research to find the correct cord size and get a longer one. or just get an extension cord. your choice

Reviews.Title: Died during setup
Reviews.Author: papajuan
Reviews.Content: When you buy cheap, you buy often.I was hoping this would be an inexpensive IP camera, it turned to be an expensive piece of junk that stopped working during setup..

Reviews.Title: Great quality for the price!
Reviews.Author: Bitwave
Reviews.Content: As many reviewers explained the chinglish manual is rather difficult to follow.  I quickly learned it was much easier to plug the camera directly to a laptop directly with no router or hub, insert the CD, find the IPcam, set the Network settings then plug it to a router.  Configuration of the device is not intuitive however with a little patience  I had this little gem setup and working perfectly.  I turned off DNS in the device settings completely and setup port forwarding on my router then I was able to log into it from the internet using my home IP/IP-CAM port number without having a hosted DNS from china. If you dont have IP networking skills this product could be challenging and maybe down right frustrating to set up. I will buy more of these cams in the future.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the money but pretty basic
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Setting up the camera was very easy, though the print in the manual was so small it was very hard to read. Fortunately a more complete manual pdf is available on the included CD. When viewing inside my house the quality of the video is really good though you can only go up to 640x480 resolution. When viewing it outside the quality isn't bad but what it is really lacking is the ability to zoom. My house is on a small hill and I wanted to use the camera to capture video of cars coming and going into my driveway below. However it's really too far away when placing the camera in a window, I would never be able to capture a license plate for example. Also, the camera has all kinds of lights around the edges that reflect in the window, I have no idea why they thought that was needed since most people want their camera hidden. Fortunately some electrical tape seems to resolve that problem. Though I am going to keep the camera I am going to look for something better.

Reviews.Title: Don't have time for this
Reviews.Author: JayMan
Reviews.Content: Firewall disabled. MAC never shows up on my LAN. Camera never gets an IP, therefore. Numerous cables and resets  no help. I'm 0-2 with these IP cameras. Guess I'll try a third vendor, then I quit.

Reviews.Title: More than I expected.
Reviews.Author: Tag Fan
Reviews.Content: The camera is super simple to set up and the night vision is great. I must say that it's much better than I anticipated.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: jason
Reviews.Content: Only works with windows xp. This camera is obsolete. No audio no recording. Doesn't work beyond home network unless I have xp.

Reviews.Title: as advertised, I feel secure
Reviews.Author: lestergardner
Reviews.Content: router code is what finnaly got it working( name instruction/YouTube vids use different name for router), easy NF & net eye TV android market work beautifully tho different functions, the download site on box gives easyn app,....but all free. whatch, listen/talk, control from any tablet/computer/phone from anywhere

Reviews.Title: Zoneminder
Reviews.Author: Michael P. Weber
Reviews.Content: I have one of these and a foscam.  When I got this I did not want to pay the foscam price.  Works great with zoneminder.  I hate that these guys do not put IR switches on these things.  I had to tape over it because I wanted to point the cam through a window.  I know I can take it apart and I might.

Reviews.Title: Not Too Happy
Reviews.Author: Greg LaPoint
Reviews.Content: Not very user friendly - Directions and software don't help much either. I still don't have it working right. I will not be ordering anymore of these.

Reviews.Title: as advertised, shipped on time
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: arrived on time and wooks as advertised with the exception of the sound which is sketchy or inconsistant (turns on and off intermitently) the free app that I found for these is limited and does not work on my windows phone. The  app. that is sold on line is also limited as to the functions and number of cameras that can be used on one single application, but does work on my windows phone. After following the instructions for internet interface, I can not get these cameras to work outside of my local lan connection  This camera is more reliable that the others that Ihave used.

Reviews.Title: Do not waste your money!
Reviews.Author: Life at the Lake
Reviews.Content: I bought this being a little iffy on being able to set it up to monitor my home.  I read the reviews and thought I would be able to handle it since I'm pretty good with "computer" stuff.  Well apparently it takes a lot more knowledge than I can provide even with using the quick installation guide sent with the camera. I even downloaded the full manual and printed it out.  I CANNOT get it to work.  Sending it back and probably losing money on it so don't waste yours to give it a try.

Reviews.Title: this cam needs updated software
Reviews.Author: robert mcnear
Reviews.Content: I'm running windows 8 and portable wireless internet.. Searching the entire web for support xp software is a thing of the past...

Reviews.Title: Nifty, but...
Reviews.Author: RoadRunner
Reviews.Content: Other than the wireless function not working*, this was a nifty little camera at a great price. Because the wireless was broken, I have returned it, but reordered a replacement.A few other reviews recommend having sufficient wireless N bandwidth. This is kind of pointless, since the specs clearly state that it only communicates via B/G. I am guessing they were thrown off by the brand name, "EasyN".As far as the rest of the features, it worked great when wired into my network. Using the Android app via 4G or WiFi was great, but over 3G the pan and tilt controls didn't work very well, which is understandable. The various web interfaces were also better than I expected. The video quality was more than acceptable under both florescent and low light/IR conditions.*I'm not saying that it would not work with my wireless network, but that the wireless did not work at all... when polling, it did not see any of the wireless networks in my area.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!
Reviews.Author: JBN
Reviews.Content: This thing works as advertised once you get it set up properly.  It allows me to view from my mobile phone which is exactly what I wanted it to do.  I may get another one in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great for a nanny cam.....
Reviews.Author: nick
Reviews.Content: I got this for a nanny cam. The setup was a bit tricky because its got a default IP on it and its set for DHCP. So I had to browse to the default IP address using IE and changed the configs. I also recommend using Tiny Cam for android to view it remotely.

Reviews.Title: Very good for the price
Reviews.Author: Mallok
Reviews.Content: It works well enough as a baby monitor, which is why I bought it.  Sometimes it loses connectivity with wireless and has to be restarted.  The software is terrible but it can be navigated.  The price makes up for most of the shortcomings, but it isn't a 5 star product.

Reviews.Title: WARNING: Suspicious Behavior
Reviews.Author: Vance T Palodichuk
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my brother so he could monitor his house when he is out of town.The camera appeared to work out of the box when connected with Ethernet, but when my brother tried to connect to his Wifi he got an "invalid params" error. After some poking around we discovered that we got that error when we tried to change any settings. The camera has a feature that allows you to connect the camera to a dynamic DNS service so you can easily log in over the internet. Much to my surprise it was pre-configured to use a DDNS hosted by EasyN. The information was even printed on a sticker on the box. While that may be convenient it also means that EasyN could connect to your camera and spy on you. Am I being paranoid? Remember again that I cannot make any changes to the settings, so it's stuck with the EasyN DDNS service.After researching the CGI command that's sent to the camera to change the settings I was able to make changes and turn off the DDNS. I had to remove the username, password, and "next url" in the URL.Beware: out of the box the manufacturer of this camera can spy on you.

Reviews.Title: I hate this camera.
Reviews.Author: coreymillia
Reviews.Content: I rated this camera with 2 stars only because it works. Thats about all it does is barely work. It Is not easy to set up, I am able to view it on my own internet connection only. But my lack of installation skills is not the problem. The problem is the poor controls no matter what you press it doesnt respond until its one end or the other. Its So frustrating the presets are worthless. The IR is useless. Its pretty much a piece of trash for $40 you hope someone sees it and thinks they are being recorded. The fact that you have to sort through many IP camera programs before you can actually find one that records is completely stupid.

Reviews.Title: Horrible misrepresentation
Reviews.Author: brandon Samms
Reviews.Content: If you have the cables and power boosters this camera would be OK for a LAN option, however the wireless capabilities are so bad they should never be in the title. It is not easy and I doubt it could be wireless. I do not recommend for that application but for the price not a bad option for something simple like seeing who is behind you when you are at your computer. Also figuring out internet access is next to impossible. While not a professional, I would rate myself slightly above amateur when it comes to networking.

Reviews.Title: Very low frame rate, horrible software, lacks advertised features
Reviews.Author: Gadget Junky
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money on this. As described, it is exclusively for night vision and can't see color. Everything displays in black and white with an unnatural violet tint to certain objects that has no relationship to its actual color. The  Central Management Software installs and loads in Windows but is apparently some generic software for other cameras and so minimally documented it never actually found the camera so it's utterly useless. The audio features simply don't work either in Windows or on the iPhone. Favorable aspects are that you can get a low quality image to display in the IE web browser without much effort, and a tiny grainy image on the iPhone in iOS Safari. Outside of IE on the desktop the picture quality is extremely poor and runs at only 2-3 frames per second even when using a wired connection on the local network. The device is obviously struggling to compress and send even 2 frames per second as MJPEG. If you want to see actual motion you won't get it, just choppy frames of someone beginning to enter then exiting but they will cross the entire frame without ever being seen. Yes, I downloaded and read every one of the pathetic excuses for a manual. It's a disappointment that the manufacturer could have, with just slightly more effort, delivered a useable product. However every aspect except the camera housing itself is simply not ready to market. From its rough, unfinished and crudely documented viewer software, the Central Management Software that is useless, an essentially black & white camera with such extremely low frame rates it can't really be termed "motion" and, as nearly 100% of the iPhone AppStore reviews mention, the audio feature simply doesn't work to send or receive sound - doesn't work at all. It's going right back in the box today to be returned. As the star rating indicates, I hate it. A simply horrible product and a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: It's a low resolution camera, what can I say!
Reviews.Author: Lester J. Nissley "Les"
Reviews.Content: This is OK for low resolution, but I wouldn't use it for a security camera. Better cameras will cost you alot more!

Reviews.Title: Pain to Set up
Reviews.Author: D.M.Banks
Reviews.Content: I am fairly computer savy, but this was a real pain in the tail to set up.  the instructions are in broken English/Chinese.  Once set up, it has worked very good.  I can opperate the camera while I am away from home and it can be set up to send you an email with approximately 6 or 8 photos of whatever set off the camera.  It has programmable settings that allows you to pick specific points, kind of like hot-keys, pick #1 and the camera swings to point number one and select #2 and it will swing to the specific point you set for #2 and so forth.  It does NOT read colors very well though.  Black shorts may very well look purple in the pictures so it cannot be relied upon for say you saw a guy with a red shirt and blue pants, the subject may be wearing something completely different.  It can give you enough detail to identify someone based of physical features, just not colors.Other than that, it works well.

Reviews.Title: Dont waste you money on this
Reviews.Author: Customer
Reviews.Content: Ok for one I work with networking and understand the configuration for routers ect. Iam unable to get this camera to work and iam in IT, so really your average user will have no luck. The online support is as follows "is the power light on?". "is the light green?" "are the other lights on?" , :"is your firewall on? " that's as far as the support live web chat will help. Ive gone as far as to install a clean version of win7 and try to use the cam the software found the camera once and never again. So if I were you go with something else because if an advanced user cannot get this thing to work all I an say is "let the force be with you.". You for now I will be returning this paper weight

Reviews.Title: Dont Waste Your Time
Reviews.Author: Ezra
Reviews.Content: This is a very poorly made product. Only works when on a LAN Network. If you want to buy a IP camera, buy a Foscam.

Reviews.Title: Trird
Reviews.Author: MICKEYY
Reviews.Content: I had to send it back Because could not Get It to Work, The instructions were hard to follow. I would make it easer

Reviews.Title: Dont buy this...
Reviews.Author: Phil Grennan
Reviews.Content: Useless product. Had to find my own apps to even be able to see device on network with a MAC (seriously?) and then it never picked up a picture...I gave up...too bad it took me so long to try to return and now I am stuck with this piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Only for the IT Savy
Reviews.Author: bobazon
Reviews.Content: Unless you really are advanced in IT, save yourself the agony. Furthermore, once you get it working, you will be unimpressed. Instruction manual included may as well have remained in Chinese . It is of no value.A great concept that I hope a great little small company in the US builds one day.

Reviews.Title: Very good Product, Once you get to understand it
Reviews.Author: Old Man Bob
Reviews.Content: I got this cam as additions to my security DVR just to try how good the night vision is. Turn out to be it was great. Night vision is better than I expected. 2 ways audio is surpricingly good. All in all the hardware is very good. But the software SUCKS! big time. I have to use IP Camviewer for my phone to monitor all the cameras I have in the system. For Audio and camera control I have to use their program, and it in Chainese. Just have to guess and try buttons to see what happen when you push it. But once you understand it, it work well. I might get the third one soon.

Reviews.Title: If only it had range
Reviews.Author: M. Bilberry "The Oracle"
Reviews.Content: This poor thing can't hold a signal when it's further than 10-15 feet away from the router. My PS3 and smart TV can pick up signals better than this thing which is saying something since both of those have very cheap parts for intercepting Wifi signals.The features on this camera are a bit complicated to setup but if you pay attention and go through each setting thoroughly then you should have no problem configuring it to what you want. The real problem comes into play when you want to place it a reasonable distance from your router.

Reviews.Title: VERY DIFFICULT TO SET UP
Reviews.Author: Leonard M. Puthoff
Reviews.Content: The connected initial set up went well, but the remote viewing is very difficult.  I have over 5 hours in the on line remote viewing set up and still does not work on line.  The manual on the disk cannot be printed unless you pay a fee for an Adobe program/service.  I think it is going back tomorrow.  I went on You Tube and there are many videos, but I have not been successful in the set or viewing on line.

Reviews.Title: This would not work with my Win7
Reviews.Author: First try of the style
Reviews.Content: I returned for refund.  Never got remote monitoring to work.  Struggled to get Computer to find it.  It could be me, but I'd rather spend more to get more ease of set-up.

Reviews.Title: Good Unit - Sucky Software
Reviews.Author: E. A. Jacques
Reviews.Content: I purchased this unit to use for security in my home. My intent was to have it alert me by email and/or mobile text when there was movement in my house while also being able to access it remotely via the web.The good news is the camera itself is very well made and delivers a decent clear picture over the web. The bad news is the software used to setup and use the camera absolutely sucks. The included instruction manual is a joke. Setting this thing up to work over wireless is one major chore too. Finding information on the web in English is also a frustrating experience. There are a few YouTube videos on it, but none of them were comprehensive enough to cover anything but the most basic setup.As of today I have still not gotten the wireless connection to work or figured out how to get it to send alerts to my mobile device or email. There is just no reason why it should be that difficult to setup. I have worked in IT for over 15 years and have installed many routers and switches in my day. I have had no problem setting up numerous devices in my home to access my wireless network.I am sure I will eventually get it to work as it should but that will not change my opinion or review of this product. If you want a good remote access camera this thing will work well for you. If you want to configure some of the advanced functions described be ready for a challenge.

Reviews.Title: I've got it working
Reviews.Author: C. Authement
Reviews.Content: Okay, I cannot speak much for the product itself due to to fact that I've not viewed the camera yet. The point of this product review is to help the community out with getting this thing set up. The software that comes with this device to find and configure it uses an IP protocol called IPX. This is why so many people are having trouble setting this thing up. When Microsoft released Windows Vista, they discontinued the IPX protocol and canceled support for it. You can configure this camera by either using a Windows XP system or run a virtual machine of Windows XP. There are "hacks" for post-Vista systems to run the IPX protocol, but those are a little more advanced. A Goggle search or two can send you down that road if you so desire. Anyway, good luck and happy peeping.

Reviews.Title: EasyN Wireless WIFI IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Tech Guy
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for almost a year. It has only worked about 1 day a week in that time. It drops it's network connection regularly.(It is running from a UPS system) When it does connect, the audio feature is awful, the motors make a constant grinding noise unless the camera is "parked" (looking straight down). It can cause interferance with other wireless devices (not FCC compliant)!The instructions for set up are written badly. The "provided" web address for online monitoring does not work. Plan on getting a Dyndns.org account for secure remote viewing. Look on the web on you-tube for some good tutorials. You had better have some strong networking skills to keep this camera connected. I would Not recomend this to anyone unless you are looking for a lot of aggrevation and dissapointment. Sometimes cheap is just cheap!

Reviews.Title: cool camera
Reviews.Content: it is not wireless in that you can leave it somewhere and you can see what is happening.it must be connected to a computer for it to work.it is a really good infrared camera.

Reviews.Title: The boat from china lost my item
Reviews.Author: Michael Arnold
Reviews.Content: I want to warn people. Yes stuff from china is good but I've had two things *lost* on boats from China.I am mad that I didn't get this IP camera. They gave me my money back but wish I got my camera but its too late, I don't have the money AND I wouldn't give them money again. You never know if things will get *lost*
